headline: Okta Stock Gets a Buy Rating Ahead of Earnings. Why It’s Being Upgraded Now.
summary: Okta  got a boost from a Wall Street analyst as investors prepare for the identity-security company’s second-quarter earnings.  Junaid Siddiqui of Truist Securities upgraded shares to Buy from Hold and lifted his price target to $125 from $100 in a research note on Monday.  Shareholders should expect solid quarterly results, Siddiqui said, and  Okta  is well-positioned in a market ripe for consolidation.
